data.text: @TheTalkCBS i think both party should be held responcible he must have watched it and played it before he posted . if youtube allows it then they should be responsible too

@TheTalkCBS I think everyone is over reacting to the situation. Suicide happens every day. No one made a big deal when the little girl on Facebook killed her self live and then all these other sites started making it public. He made a mistake and has apologize. Let it go.

@TheTalkCBS Sharon stated she didn’t think they should post how to make a bomb... I requested Facebook to review a post that was exactly that and they didn’t remove it! It was a warning about not picking up bottles with small amounts of liquids and drano exploding when mixed with movement.

@TheTalkCBS When I put up part of the S.O.S. psychic documentary I was in in Japan part of it got pulled because it dramatically depicted how a man was murdered only showing him being pushed down the stairs their was no blood and it got pulled and they didnt pull that whats up with that
@TheTalkCBS I think this kid taking a break from YouTube was not his idea. However, he should be banned for life.
@Jacx_Ballard @TheTalkCBS Ohh I agree 💯.... it's just sad that probably won't happen.
@TheTalkCBS He could have set it up! He has allot of money to play with. He could have had a ClickBait! Just fot views. More views more money. So,on

@WICKEDLADYBOLT @TheTalkCBS Yeah, I figured, but I wish they could at least fine him or something. Something that holds them both more responsible and teaches the lesson, "I am sorry" Doesn't always fix things.

@Jacx_Ballard @TheTalkCBS The problem is YouTube makes a lot of money off him and from a business aspect they won't remove his videos or ban him :/ morality always sways when money is involved unfortunately.

@TheTalkCBS The same technology that gives us marketable live streaming should also provide protection for consumers. YouTube should have an algorithm to detect this  activity & cut the feed if necessary. BUT, the individual owns the content and has responsibility also.
@TheTalkCBS After watching that clip, he needs to learn to held responsibility for his actions #EverybodyTalks

@TheTalkCBS I don't agree with the fact it was posted, but his actions was an action of someone who was scared, nervous and traumatized. The only people who can understand are the people who were there. If anyone else was in there shoes, what would they have done?

@TheTalkCBS He is responsible, but they are about money and he brings in a lot of views. But they should put aside that and have respect for the friends and family of the person that committed suicide. And what way was that video trying to help ppl thinking of suicide??

@TheTalkCBS ok this is a dumb question. The person uploading the video is 1000000000% responsible. if you have morals you know what you can and cannot post. This kid obviously only cares about how many hits he can get and not about anything else. #EverybodyTalks

@TheTalkCBS First he is responsible he filmed it, he edited and he posted it. However Youtube went crazy a few weeks ago removing videos if a family as much said poop in a video. If they are that focused on keeping Youtube safe, they need to be responsible for this too, and fining or banning
@TheTalkCBS He thought it was funny and he’s only “reflecting” because the rest of us didn’t.🙄
